intro: Adinandra trichocoryna var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved adinandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stems. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, often blooming during the rainy season. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
